private_information: I can only move blocks whose labels are vowels: A, E, I.
I can move at most one block at a time and only if that block is at the top of a stack.
vowel_agent.goal: Rearrange the blocks so that A is on B, B is on C, C is on D, D is on E, E is on F, F is on G, G is on H, H is on I, I is on J, J is on K, K is on L, L is on M, and M is on the table.

private_information: I can only move blocks whose labels are consonants: B, C, D, F, G, H, J, K, L, M.
I can move at most one block at a time and only if that block is at the top of a stack.
consonant_agent.goal: Rearrange the blocks so that A is on B, B is on C, C is on D, D is on E, E is on F, F is on G, G is on H, H is on I, I is on J, J is on K, K is on L, L is on M, and M is on the table.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate the partial plans produced by the two agents and produce a final PDDL domain and problem compatible with the FastDownwards solver that achieves the target block stacking.

public_information: There are 13 uniquely labelled blocks: H, G, K, B, M, F, D, L, A, E, J, C, I.
Agents can only interact with the block at the top of each stack and can move only one block at a time.
One agent may move only vowel-labelled blocks and the other only consonant-labelled blocks.
Initial stacks are: Stack1 bottom-to-top H, G, K, B, D, L, I and Stack2 bottom-to-top M, F, A, E, J, C.
The goal configuration is a single stack bottom-to-top M, L, K, J, I, H, G, F, E, D, C, B, A where M is on the table and each listed block is on the one below it as specified.

analysis.system_prompt: You are the vowel specialist. Your responsibility is to produce a clear, ordered local move sequence that involves only vowel-labelled blocks A, E, and I. You must respect that you can only move a block when it is at the top of its stack and you can move only one block at a time. Do not emit PDDL. If you need to state assumptions about unknown details, list them explicitly.
analysis.prompt: Your name is vowel_agent. You can act only on vowel blocks A, E, I. Use the public information about initial stacks and the global goal to propose a sequence of local moves that you can perform or recommend to facilitate achieving the global goal. Explain any assumptions and limitations. Provide the plan as an ordered list of moves in plain text.

analysis.system_prompt: You are the consonant specialist. Your responsibility is to produce a clear, ordered local move sequence that involves only consonant-labelled blocks. You must respect that you can only move a block when it is at the top of its stack and you can move only one block at a time. Do not emit PDDL. If you need to state assumptions about unknown details, list them explicitly.
analysis.prompt: Your name is consonant_agent. You can act only on consonant blocks B, C, D, F, G, H, J, K, L, M. Use the public information about initial stacks and the global goal to propose a sequence of local moves that you can perform or recommend to facilitate achieving the global goal. Explain any assumptions and limitations. Provide the plan as an ordered list of moves in plain text.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator responsible for integrating partial plans into a complete multi-agent PDDL model. Produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file compatible with the FastDownwards planner. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep the actions of the two agents distinct by naming or typing actions to indicate which agent can execute them. Resolve naming ambiguities and ensure the domain encodes the constraint that vowels are only moved by the vowel agent and consonants only by the consonant agent. Target FastDownwards conventions and avoid solver-specific extensions beyond standard PDDL that FastDownwards supports.
pddl.prompt: You are orchestrator. Integrate the environment public information and the following partial plans produced by the agents. Use them to build a complete PDDL domain and problem for the FastDownwards solver that achieves the global stacking goal. Here is the public information: {environment->public_information}. Here is the vowel agent partial plan: {partial_vowel_plan}. Here is the consonant agent partial plan: {partial_consonant_plan}. Keep agent actions distinct and include types or action prefixes to reflect which agent may perform each move. If a partial plan is missing necessary details, fill them in conservatively and document the assumptions. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> and the problem between <problem></problem> tags.
